page.title: 09EAST TILBURY
page.content: The part of {East Tilbury}with which we are concerned consists of many between-the-wars bungalows near the railway and a large post-war housing estate mainly built by the {Bata shoe}factory.This firm favours a paternalistic attitude towards their workers and provided a large sports ground,a cinema, a hotel, a junior and an infant school, shops and a dairy farm.Unfortunately with the recession the factory is no longer so flourishing and the farm and hotel are no longer there.Nevertheless the community has grown and includes a number of fast food shops and a four-doctor surgery. The original village of East Tilbury is just down the road towards the Thames with individually-styled houses but sharing most of the facilities.
